_header: As that a great clerk shows in his books
Note: See 671; the rhyming paraphrase of the Ten Commandments occurs separately as 5843.
_description: A Wycliffite expansion of Gaytryge’s Lay Folk’s Catechism (671) — in non-rhyming alliterative verse

Lam408.First Lines:
As a gret clerk tellys and schewys in his bokysOf alle þe
                    creaturis þat god made in heuyn and erthe…
Lam408.Last Lines:
Kunnyngly to know god almyȝty ys endles lyf and lastynge
                    blysseHe bryngge vs þerto þat bowȝt vs with hys herte blod
                    on þe cros Christ Ihesu Amen
Lam408.Attributed Title: Mandatum domini Johannis de ThoresbyEbor. arhciepi
Lam408.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick,  and  Henry Edward Nolloth, eds.  
             “The Lay Folks’ Catechism.” 
             EETS
         o.s. 118 (1901); repr. 1987: 3-99.
